nodes.bodyText: @victornoel @olenagerasimova yes, joe is like a user id, but joe@mail.com is a part of login credentials. I think it's ok that user may have multiple credentials, since it's possible that different repository authentications will require different credentials format. E.g. Maven requires HTTP basic, so we can use joe and password to authenticate it, but another repository may required different authentication method (e.g. using token), but we still want to authenticate joe user by token too and configure authorization permissions using his user id. Is it clearer now?
